item.title: Dead fox in a public area, 17th June
item.description:
This fix has been laying in a field for a couple of days now it has rotted and the smell is unbearable it has also attracted a lot of flies. It is located at Buckler gardens near the edge of the field.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Speke Hill, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vandalized Trees, 17th June
item.description:
The trees in this area of the park grounds planted just a few years back are being systematically vandalized. The wooden stakes supporting the tress are being dig out and used to vandalize other areas. Some of the young tress have been vandalized as well which is a crime and intolerable behaviour and use of the grounds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maple Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bits of tarmac on the pay and display parking spaces on left hand side as you enter Meadow Rd, 17th June
item.description:
The machinery used to resurface Beckenham lane last week parked on our road and left loads of detritus and lumps of tarmac on and around the Pay and display spaces on the left hand side at the beginning of Meadow road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chart Close, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Knocked down wooden fence, 17th June
item.description:
Please be aware that there is a knocked down wooden fence into a shrubs area withing park grounds. This shrubs area is used by homeless, vandals and crack heads as a toiled, to dismantle stolen mopeds, dump rubbish, etc. nearby there is a large gas/butane tank dumped as well. This specific part of the grounds needs to be cleared of the outer brush,fallen tree branches and rubbish so people dont use it as a toilet as well

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avington Grove, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clamped car for weeks, 17th June
item.description:
There is clamped car on the road outside Cavendish apartments. It’s been clamped for several weeks that I know of, possibly months. How long will it be before the car is removed and the space it’s taking up freed up for others to park? Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin and litter on street, 17th June
item.description:
One bin doesn't seem to be enough as it is constantly overflowing and there is litter all over the ground. Would it be possible to install a second?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilton Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Litter, 17th June
item.description:
Somebody has left a bin bag of household waste next to the bin. Would like it removed before the foxes rip it up and I end up with someone else’s rubbish all over my garden. Years ago we had a bin at this bus stop and this problem occurred frequently. The bin was removed and no litter. The bins back and the extra litter has started again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Lullingstone Crescent, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car blocking access, 17th June
item.description:
A Silver Vauxhall has been left on Astbury Road for several days, blocking vehicle access to and from Regal Row. A number of residents have now been unable to take their vehicles out. Online checks show that there the car is untaxed and has no MOT.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regal Row, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
